page.title: 06Leckford-Apples and Dairying
page.content: On Leckford Estate 175 acres are used for{apple growing.}The main variety grown is Coxes Orange Pippin and the yield is about 1000 tons each year.20 people are employed fulltime on apple growing but more are needed part time in the picking season.The apples are kept in a refrigerated store before they are sold. There is a{dairying department}at Leckford ,with a herd of 180 Friesian cows,each producing 1200 gallons of milk a year.There are also 150 heifers, 50 in three age groups, calves,yearlings and two year olds,all of which join the herd when they are three years old. 60 male calves are sold each year for beef.
